issues.title: Frontend - Setup React + Vite + TailwindCSS
issues.description:
## Feature Description
Set up the foundational frontend development environment using React as the UI framework, Vite as the build tool for fast development and optimized production builds, and TailwindCSS for utility-first styling. This includes configuring all necessary dependencies, setting up the project structure, and ensuring hot module replacement works correctly.

## Category
functional

## Test Steps
1. Navigate to the project root directory
2. Run `npm install` to install all dependencies
3. Run `npm run dev` to start the development server
4. Verify the server starts on the configured port (e.g., http://localhost:5173)
5. Open the application in a browser and verify a basic React component renders
6. Modify a component file and verify hot module replacement updates the browser without full reload
7. Verify TailwindCSS classes are being applied correctly
8. Run `npm run build` and verify production build succeeds
9. Check that the build output is optimized and minified

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] React 18+ is installed and configured
- [ ] Vite is set up with proper configuration file (vite.config.js)
- [ ] TailwindCSS is installed with tailwind.config.js and postcss.config.js
- [ ] Development server starts without errors
- [ ] Hot module replacement works for component changes
- [ ] TailwindCSS utility classes render correctly
- [ ] Production build completes successfully
- [ ] Project structure follows best practices (src/, public/, etc.)
- [ ] TypeScript is configured (if using TS) or ESLint for JS
- [ ] Package.json contains all necessary scripts (dev, build, preview)
